history.content: I believe the original 294 class will always be offered in the 100 series from now on according to the Professor who's teaching it.
You should email CS Advising with this request. I'd suggest including the syllabus or faculty recommendation.

I'm interested in taking CS 194-129 Designing, Visualizing and Understanding Deep Neural Networks next semester.

It looks like the Grad version of the class, CS 294-129, is on the CS website as one of the approved classes for applying towards upper-div units. https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-upperdiv

Is it reasonable to expect that the Undergrad version of this course will be added to this list as well?

Do these approved 194/294-series courses apply towards the "8 units upper-division CS courses" as part of the "20 upper division units" requirement, or only the "7 units of Upper Division Technical Electives" requirement?
history.subject: LSCS Upper Div Units for CS 194-129?
